Bash(git -C /Users/justin/Documents/DevProjects/MyWorker commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix WASM loading: serve wa-sqlite.wasm from public/ via locateFile

The Emscripten-generated .mjs resolves the .wasm relative to itself,
which breaks when Vite bundles it into assets/. Fix by:
- Copying wa-sqlite.wasm and wa-sqlite-async.wasm into public/ so they
  are served at a stable root path \(/wa-sqlite.wasm\)
- Passing locateFile to SQLiteESMFactory so Emscripten fetches from /
- Updating the type stub to accept Emscripten options
- Moving WASM out of precache glob and into runtime CacheFirst caching

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C /Users/justin/Documents/DevProjects/MyWorker commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Switch to async WASM build + IDBBatchAtomicVFS \(main-thread compatible\)

AccessHandlePoolVFS requires createSyncAccessHandle which only works
inside a Web Worker. On the main thread it throws ''not a function''.

Fix:
- Replace wa-sqlite.mjs \(sync\) with wa-sqlite-async.mjs \(async build\)
- Replace AccessHandlePoolVFS with IDBBatchAtomicVFS \(IndexedDB-backed,
  works on main thread, no Worker required\)
- OneDrive persistence now writes a JSON snapshot after each write
  \(same format as manual backup\) rather than copying a raw SQLite file
- Add IDBBatchAtomicVFS and wa-sqlite-async type stubs

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
